      • getBestCountermeasures

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,Countermeasure>> getBestCountermeasures(Heuristics heuristic,
                                                                                                   char X)
        Returns a sorted list with the best (not applied) countermeasure for every node in the path. The list is sorted on security score (weighted difficulty average). If 'D' is used as emphasis, the countermeasure with the highest difficulty increase of each node is added to a list, which is first sorted on security score and then by decreasing difficulty-increase. Likewise for 'C' (complexity).
        Parameters:
        heuristic -
        X - 'D' or 'C', meaning emphasis on Difficulty or Complexity while comparing
        Returns:
        Map("totalDifficulty#AttackTreeNode.name#securityScore", Countermeasure)

      • getBestExtraCM

        private Countermeasure getBestExtraCM(java.lang.String atnName,
                                      char X)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the best not applied countermeasure, with highest difficulty increase and lowest complexity for node with name 'atnName'. The emphasis X defines whether the algorithm should give precedence to highest difficulty increase or lowest complexity.
        Parameters:
        X: - 'D' or 'C', meaning emphasis on Difficulty or Complexity while comparing
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        public void initialize()

      • markStealthiesPaths

        public void markStealthiesPaths()
        Calls markStealthiestPath on the root

      • mergeActiveAttackers

        private void mergeActiveAttackers()
        Calculates the union of all active attackers. The 'merged' attacker is the attacker attribute of the attack tree.

      • printTree

        public void printTree()

      • recalculateDepth

        private void recalculateDepth()
        Calculate the total depth of the tree

      • recalculateDifficulty

        public void recalculateDifficulty()
        Recalculate the difficulty parameter of the attack tree. Successively calls mergeActiveAttackers, node.setDifficultyCM (for each node), addDifficultyToLeaves and root.calculateDifficulty

      • recalculateStealth

        public void recalculateStealth()
        Calls calculateStealth on the root.
